data.benefits: Scheme provides apprentice stipend upto Rs. 0.09 lakhs or 50% reimbursement, whichever is less.
data.eligibility:
Employers:
Any organization or establishment (public or private sector) can participate in NATS, provided they are willing to offer structured apprenticeship training under skilled mentors.
Apprentices:
Graduate Students, Diploma Holders, and Vocational Certificate Holders are eligible for the scheme.
data.conditions: Apprentices must be willing to undergo on-the-job training for 6 months to 1 year.
data.beneficiaries: Employers from both public and private sectors can participate in NATS, provided they are willing to offer structured apprenticeship training under skilled mentors. The program allows organizations to develop a skilled workforce while contributing to industry-specific training. Apprentices eligible for the scheme include graduate students, diploma holders, and vocational certificate holders, enabling them to gain hands-on experience and enhance their career prospects through practical training.
data.prerequisites: Apprentices are required to undergo on-the-job training for a period of 6 months to 1 year. During this time, they gain hands-on experience and practical skills that complement their academic knowledge. The training helps apprentices develop industry-specific competencies, preparing them for full-time employment.
data.nodal_agency: Director of Board Of Apprenticeship Training (BOAT)
data.context: The National Apprenticeship Training Scheme (NATS) is a key initiative that aims to improve India’s workforce by providing industry-based training to young professionals, enabling them to gain hands-on experience and enhancing their skills for better career opportunities.
data.objective: It also provides a financial incentive to employers by reimbursing part of the stipend they pay to apprentices, fostering skill development at all levels of industry.
data.description:
The apprentices are paid a stipend amount, 50% of which is reimbursable to the employer from Government of India. 
Graduate Apprentice: Rs. 9000/month
Technician Apprentice: Rs. 8000/month
Technician (Sandwich) Apprentice: Rs. 7000/month.
Graduate (Sandwich) Apprentice: Rs. 8000/month
50% Stipend Reimbursement: Financial assistance to employers through government reimbursement of half the stipend paid to apprentices.
data.how_to_apply: The applicants can apply through: https://nats.education.gov.in/index.php
data.funding_facilitator: Director of Board Of Apprenticeship Training (BOAT)
data.funding_mechanism: The National Apprenticeship Training Scheme (NATS) provides 50% stipend reimbursement to employers for training apprentices. Employers submit claims via the NATS Portal, and after verification, the government releases the funds to the employers for the apprenticeship duration.
data.checklist_info_a:
For Employers (Establishments) 
Establishment Registration: Proof of the establishment’s legal registration (e.g., GST Registration, Shop & Establishment License).
Establishment Profile: Details about the establishment, including the industry sector, training capacity, etc.
Apprenticeship Agreement: A signed agreement between the employer and the apprentice specifying terms and conditions.
Bank Details: For stipend reimbursement (if applicable), bank account details of the establishment.
Proof of Basic Training Facility: If applicable, proof of in-house or outsourced basic training facilities for apprentices.
For Apprentices (Trainees) 
Aadhar Card: For identity verification.
Educational Qualification Certificates: Proof of academic qualifications (e.g., ITI certificates, degree, etc.).
Photographs: Recent passport-sized photographs.
Date of Birth Proof: Birth certificate or any valid document showing the age of the apprentice.
Aadhar Linked Bank Account Details: For stipend disbursement through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
For Stipend Reimbursement (if applicable) 
Apprenticeship Registration: Confirmation of apprentice registration on the NATS portal.
Apprentice Attendance Records: Proof of apprentice working hours, attendance, and training.
Reimbursement Claim Form: Submission of claims for stipend reimbursement along with supporting documents.
data.beneficiary: All Industry - All Entities - All locations - All MSMEs and Non MSMEs
